intro: Symplocos crassilimba, commonly known as the thick-leaved evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are thick and leathery in texture. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible berries that are typically red when mature. Symplocos crassilimba is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
